alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clark; Codington; Day; Hamlin; Marshall; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 8:15PM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes this week. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Clark; Codington; Day; Hamlin; Marshall; Spink
